  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Internal Sales Executive",
  "description": "Limeswood International Company Limited is a company with many years of industrial experience in software development, Integrated Security Services and IT distribution excellence. We pride ourselves in being the pioneer of all IT solutions in west Africa and employing individuals with innovations and creativities. With a vast amount of knowledge and experience, as well as devoted employees, our company is acting as the leading force through innovation, excellence, and providing clients with up-to-date, tailor made IT solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Sales Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos

Job Summary


	The Internal Sales Executive will be responsible for supporting the entire sales process from lead generation and client relationship management to order processing and after-sales support.
	The ideal candidate is proactive, detail-oriented, and adaptable, with the ability to quickly learn and use digital procurement platforms such as Ariba and NipeX.


Key Responsibilities
Sales &amp; Client Relationship Management:


	Develop and maintain strong relationships with existing and prospective clients.
	Respond promptly to client inquiries, prepare and follow up on quotations, and close sales.
	Support external sales and business development teams by handling inbound leads and client requests.
	Proactively reach out to potential clients to introduce the company&rsquo;s products and services.
	Maintain a thorough understanding of all product lines and service offerings.


Order &amp; Documentation Management:


	Prepare and process sales quotations, purchase orders, invoices, and other documentation in line with company procedures.
	Ensure timely follow-up on orders, delivery schedules, and client satisfaction.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date sales records and client databases (CRM).
	Coordinate with other departments (Finance, Operations, Logistics) to ensure efficient service delivery.


Reporting &amp; Analysis:


	Track and report sales performance, including leads, conversions, and revenue.
	Monitor customer feedback and market trends to identify new opportunities and areas for improvement.
	Prepare periodic sales reports and participate in sales meetings.


Administrative &amp; Coordination Support:


	Assist in preparing proposals, presentations, and bids.
	Support marketing activities such as client outreach, database management, and product promotions.
	Handle routine administrative tasks and ensure professional communication with clients.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or any related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in internal sales, business development, or sales support.
	Proven ability to manage client relationships and contribute to sales targets.
	Experience in handling client accounts, quotations, and documentation processes.
	Familiarity with procurement processes or willingness to learn digital bidding platforms (Ariba, NipeX) is an advantage.


Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Excellent customer service orientation.
	Good organizational and multitasking abilities.
	Strong attention to detail and accuracy in documentation.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and CRM tools.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Target-driven, with a positive and professional attitude.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to:&nbsp;Hr@limeswood.com.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

We pride ourselves in being the pioneer of all IT solutions in west Africa and employing individuals with innovations and creativities. With a vast amount of knowledge and experience, as well as devoted employees, our company is acting as the leading force through innovation, excellence, and providing clients with up-to-date, tailor made IT solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Sales Executive

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos

Job Summary

	The Internal Sales Executive will be responsible for supporting the entire sales process from lead generation and client relationship management to order processing and after-sales support.
	The ideal candidate is proactive, detail-oriented, and adaptable, with the ability to quickly learn and use digital procurement platforms such as Ariba and NipeX.


Key Responsibilities
Sales & Client Relationship Management:


	Develop and maintain strong relationships with existing and prospective clients.
	Respond promptly to client inquiries, prepare and follow up on quotations, and close sales.
	Support external sales and business development teams by handling inbound leads and client requests.
	Proactively reach out to potential clients to introduce the company’s products and services.
	Maintain a thorough understanding of all product lines and service offerings.


Order & Documentation Management:


	Prepare and process sales quotations, purchase orders, invoices, and other documentation in line with company procedures.
	Ensure timely follow-up on orders, delivery schedules, and client satisfaction.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date sales records and client databases (CRM).
	Coordinate with other departments (Finance, Operations, Logistics) to ensure efficient service delivery.


Reporting & Analysis:


	Track and report sales performance, including leads, conversions, and revenue.
	Monitor customer feedback and market trends to identify new opportunities and areas for improvement.
	Prepare periodic sales reports and participate in sales meetings.


Administrative & Coordination Support:


	Assist in preparing proposals, presentations, and bids.
	Support marketing activities such as client outreach, database management, and product promotions.
	Handle routine administrative tasks and ensure professional communication with clients.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or any related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in internal sales, business development, or sales support.
	Proven ability to manage client relationships and contribute to sales targets.
	Experience in handling client accounts, quotations, and documentation processes.
	Familiarity with procurement processes or willingness to learn digital bidding platforms (Ariba, NipeX) is an advantage.


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Excellent customer service orientation.
	Good organizational and multitasking abilities.
	Strong attention to detail and accuracy in documentation.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and CRM tools.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Target-driven, with a positive and professional attitude.

Sales Representative Job at Ajoke Group




        
    

        
        Ajoke Group is a distribution company that deals with the supply of major FMCG's products nationwide.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Representative

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Drive a company-owned van to assigned territories, routes, or customer locations to conduct sales visits and deliveries.
	Load and unload products from the van, ensuring accurate inventory counts and proper handling of goods.
	Establish and maintain relationships with existing and potential customers, addressing their needs and preferences to drive sales.
	Present and demonstrate products or services to customers, highlighting features, benefits, and pricing information.
	Take orders from customers, process sales transactions, and issue receipts or invoices for purchases.
	Negotiate pricing, discounts, and terms with customers to maximize sales revenue and profitability.
	Cross-sell or upsell additional products or services to customers to increase order value and meet sales targets.
	Provide product recommendations, advice, and assistance to customers based on their requirements and preferences.
	Maintain accurate records of sales activities, customer interactions, and inventory levels using sales software or databases.
	Monitor competitor activities, market trends, and customer feedback to identify opportunities and challenges in the sales territory.
	Collaborate with sales managers, supervisors, and colleagues to coordinate sales activities, share insights, and develop strategies.
	Participate in sales meetings, training sessions, and product knowledge sessions to stay updated on company offerings and sales techniques.
	Resolve customer complaints, issues, or concerns in a timely and professional manner, ensuring customer satisfaction and retention.
	Follow safety protocols and driving regulations while operating the company van, ensuring safe transportation of products and personnel.
	Uphold company policies, procedures, and ethical standards in all sales and customer interactions.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess an OND, HND, or Bachelor's Degree with 1-2 years of experience.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment.asl@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
